Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Intraoperative Methylprednisolone in Neonatal Cardiac Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: Neonates undergoing cardiac surgery were randomized

Intervention.evidence: randomized to receive either intraoperative methylprednisolone or placebo

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine if intraoperative methylprednisolone during neonatal cardiac surgery is associated with neurodevelopmental outcomes at 12 months of age.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was neurodevelopmental outcomes measured by the Bayley Scales of Infant and Toddler Development-III (BSID-III) at 12 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included outcome assessors, patients, and clinicians.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 129 participants were randomized (61 to methylprednisolone, 68 to placebo)

Result_Outcome.evidence: Participants undergoing palliative procedures had lower cognitive (mean difference = -5, 95% CI -9 to -1, p=0.03) and motor scores (mean difference = -9, 95% CI -14 to -4, p<0.01).
